message_1: Let $F(x) = x^2$ and $G(x) = x+3$. Evaluate the composition $(F\circ G)(4)$.
message_2:
To evaluate the composition $(F\circ G)(4)$, we first find $G(4)$ and then substitute the result into the function $F(x)$.

$G(4) = 4 + 3 = 7$

Now, we substitute the result into the function $F(x)$:

$F(G(4)) = F(7) = 7^2 = 49$

So, $(F\circ G)(4) = 49$.
